ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.1.1_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Vesālī in the hall with the peaked roof in the Great Wood.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.1.2_0: At that time the Buddha spoke to the monks in many ways about unattractiveness—he spoke in praise of unattractiveness, in praise of developing the mind in unattractiveness, and in praise of the attainment of unattractiveness.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.1.3_0: When the message had been delivered, the Buddha said to the monks,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.1.4_0: “Monks, I wish to go into solitary retreat for half a month.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.1.5_0: No one is to approach me except the one who brings me almsfood.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.1.6_0: “Yes, Venerable Sir,” they replied, and no one approached him except the one who brought him almsfood.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.1.7_0: The monks thought, “The Buddha has talked in many ways about unattractiveness,”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.1.8_0: and they devoted themselves to the development of the mind in unattractiveness in its many different facets.

ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.1.19_0: I’ve made much demerit by killing virtuous monks.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.1.20_0: Then, walking across the water, a god from the realm of the lord of death said to Migalaṇḍika,
